# read in environmental data
require(raster)
gis.directory <- "C:/Users/awhitehead/Documents/GIS data/Hunter/data from Brendan/data/variables/projected GDA94/"
myExpl = stack( paste0(gis.directory,"clim1a.asc"), paste0(gis.directory,"clim11.asc"), paste0(gis.directory,"clim12.asc"), paste0(gis.directory,"clim11.asc"), paste0(gis.directory,"dry2000cl.asc"), paste0(gis.directory,"fert.asc"))

# ensure that all raster layers have exactly the same data cells
envi.mask <- calc(myExpl,mean)
  envi.mask[!is.na(envi.mask)] <- 1

  myExpl.mask <- myExpl*envi.mask
    myExpl.mask <- stack(myExpl.mask)

sp.names <- as.character(unique(mySpeciesOcc$index))

sp.n<- sp.names[3]

MyBiomodSF <- function(sp.n){
  
    
  ### definition of data for this run
  ## i.e keep only the column of our species

                                       PA.nb.rep = 2,
                                       PA.nb.absences = 10*sum(myResp==1,

    DataSplit=80, 
    Yweights=NULL, 
    VarImport=3,
